chapter.title: Extensions
chapter.para: Although Disnix makes the deployment of a distributed system more convenient and offers features to make this process reiable and efficient, some extensions have been developed to make this process more convenient.

section.title: DisnixWebService
section.para: In some cases other communication protocols are desired to use in order to connect to remote machines, except SSH. The DisnixWebService is a package that contains a SOAP interface for deployment operations and a disnix-soap-client utility to connect to it.

section.title: DisnixOS
section.para: Although Disnix manages the distributable components (services) of which a distributed system is composed and the inter-dependencies, Disnix does not manage the system configurations of the actual machines on which services are activated. NixOS provides the command nixos-deploy-network to manage a network of NixOS configurations. This package conbines the Disnix tooling and NixOS tooling to manage distributed system components and the underlying infrastructure based on NixOS system configurations, and an extension to automatically create virtual machine instances from the network configuration for testing.
